definition: interlude/to cross the stage/to do sth as a mere formality/to go through the motions
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams

sentences.english: I think my inspection is just some sort of formality.
sentences.chinese: 我要告诉我的客户，当不走过场起重重量。

sentences.english: I'm convinced the new method won't work but I'll still have to go through the motions .
sentences.chinese: 我深信这个新方法起不了什么作用，但仍还得走过场。

sentences.english: He was good at slicing the ball across the court.
sentences.chinese: 他很善于把球斜打过场。

sentences.english: During one walk they sing and saunter past a line of indifferent men.
sentences.chinese: 在一次过场中，她们走过一行不同的男人，边笑边闹。

sentences.english: I like to tell my clients to not just go through the motion when lifting weights.
sentences.chinese: 我要告诉我的客户，当不走过场起重重量。

sentences.english: I'm not really into this project. I'm just going through the motions.
sentences.chinese: 我对这个项目并不感冒，只是走走过场而已。

sentences.english: Such thing is all about routines.
sentences.chinese: 这种事我们一般走走过场就完了。

sentences.english: Soon after these niceties, Julie assigns me my first chore of the day.
sentences.chinese: 走完这些过场后，朱莉给我指派今天的头一个任务。

sentences.english: Now I don't even go through the motions.
sentences.chinese: 如今，我甚至不愿去“走过场”。

sentences.english: You can't afford to just coast along, or go through the motions, if you're running a business.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在经营事业的话，你不能只是走走过场而已。

sentences.english: As a result, the games will now feature more in-game cinematics and story content.
sentences.chinese: 也就是说游戏里会有更多过场动画和剧情。

sentences.english: The economy has sufficient momentum that Beijing can muddle through with piecemeal reforms for now.
sentences.chinese: 经济动力充足，令北京暂时可靠零星改革来走过场。

sentences.english: Depth of field – cutscenes: option only affects cutscenes and dialogue sequences, does not affect gameplay performance.
sentences.chinese: 过场动画景深，不影响游戏过程中的性能。

sentences.english: Cutscenes and dialogues between the characters are just only one main pillar.
sentences.chinese: 过场动画人物之间的对话，只是只有一个主要支柱。

sentences.english: Generally speaking, we don't take this kind of matter too serisouly.
sentences.chinese: 这种事我们一般走走过场就完了。

sentences.english: She's here to remind you that life is too short for simply going through the motions.
sentences.chinese: 它在提醒你，如果只是走走过场，生命可是太短暂了。

definition: dummy run/to run through sth/to rehearse
to buy soy sauce/it's none of my business ("I’m just here to buy some soy sauce")
to select sb for a position without announcing the decision until later/to decide behind closed doors/all cut and dried
a modal particle indicating (that's all, only, nothing much)
a modal particle indicating (don't mind it, ok)
from start to finish/from head to tail/the whole (thing)
only/merely/nothing but/no more than/it's just that ...
to rush to conclude a matter/to end up abruptly
